definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: For degree of differentiation, Shitanhu population is higher than that of Gutang population.
sentences.chinese: 分化程度石潭湖羣體高於古塘羣體。

sentences.english: The president's left-of-centre programme threatens to polarise Congress.
sentences.chinese: 總統的激進計劃使國會發生了兩極分化。

sentences.english: With the development of detective methods, the concept of transdifferentiation is being accepted by people.
sentences.chinese: 隨着檢測手段的進步，轉分化正逐漸被人們認同。

sentences.english: The spermatid differentiation can be divided into five stages.
sentences.chinese: 精細胞的分化可分爲五個時期。

sentences.english: Self-publishing these days is increasingly a tale of two cities.
sentences.chinese: 今自助出版越來越呈現兩極分化的趨勢。

sentences.english: The N6 macroelementsand the MS microelements were advantageous to callus formation.
sentences.chinese: N6大量元素和MS微量元素有利於愈傷組織的分化。

sentences.english: There are no or faint enzyme reaction products in low differentiated adenocarcinoma.
sentences.chinese: 低分化腺癌上述酶大都無反應或反應微弱。

sentences.english: The results of RAPD analysis suggest that the genus Agkistrodon is a highly differentiated group.
sentences.chinese: RAPD分析結果提示蝮屬是一個高度分化的類羣。

sentences.english: Usually, the plasma cells are differentiated enough to retain the function of immunoglobulin production.
sentences.chinese: 通常漿細胞分化成熟，具有產生免疫球蛋白的功能。

sentences.english: This cell differentiation process begins at about the time that the embryo settles into the uterus.
sentences.chinese: 這一細胞分化過程開始於胚胎在子宮定植的時刻。

sentences.english: Green bud was produced on the medium for differentiation.
sentences.chinese: 在分化培養基上，由愈傷組織誘導出綠芽點。

sentences.english: Serum-free hormone-supplemented medium could promote cell multiplication and differentiation.
sentences.chinese: 無血清培養基能促進細胞增殖，分化和成熟。

sentences.english: Effect of lutein on the differentiation of osteoclast induced from bone marrow were studied in vitro.
sentences.chinese: 研究葉黃素對體外破骨細胞分化的影響。

sentences.english: Both R3 and R4 had no significant effect on enhancing the growth and differentiation of D.
sentences.chinese: R3和R4對華石斛生長和分化無明顯的促進效果。

sentences.english: Besides, the shape and size of neurons within the telencephalon are in poor differentiation.
sentences.chinese: 此外，亞成體端腦內細胞形態和大小分化較爲單一。

sentences.english: Business history split off from economic history in the U. S. A. in 1920s.
sentences.chinese: 在20年代美國又將企業史從經濟史中分化出來。

definition: to wither/to dry up (of a plant)/to atrophy (of muscle, social custom etc)
to split up/to divide/to break up/fission/schism
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
expansion/dilation/to expand (e.g. one's power or influence)/to broaden
